trial_identification.studytitle: The effect of calcium supplementation on lipids and bone density in men.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effect of calcium supplementation on serum lipids and bone density in normal men.

interventions.interventions: Daily 600mg calcium (as the citrate) or 1200mg calcium (as the citrate) over 2 years.

primaryOutcome.outcome: The difference between the ratio of HDL/LDL cholesterol over 2 years in three treatment groups.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The difference between changes in LDL cholesterol, HDL cholesterol, total cholesterol, HDL/total cholesterol ratio, triglycerides.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Over 2 years in the three treatment groups.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The difference between changes in spine, hip and total body bone mineral density, blood pressure, soft tissue mass and its distribution.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Over 2 years in the three treatment groups.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Males, Age > 40 years, Life expectancy > 5 years.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Coronary heart disease, Diabetes, 5 yr predicted cardiovascular risk of > 15%, Renal impairment (serum creatinine > 0.2mmol/l), Untreated hypo- or hyperthyroidism Active liver disease Serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D < 25 nmol/l Concurrent major systemic disease, including malignancy, Metabolic bone disease, Current treatment for hyperlipidaemia or osteoporosis, Regular use of testosterone replacement therapy within the previous 1 year, Regular use of anabolic steroid preparations in the previous 1 year, Treatment with bisphosphonates in the previous 1 year, Treatment with glucocorticoid drugs in the previous year, Lumbar spine bone density < mean-2.0 SD for age-appropriate data (ie: Z score < -2).

trial_design.concealment: Subject numbers allocated by personnel based in a different building and having no contact with study subjects
trial_design.sequence: Computer-generated random numbers in variable blocks
